intro: Turnera albicans, commonly known as white turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy white flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters and emit a mild fragrance. Turnera albicans is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
